questions.question: What is the primary fuel for nuclear fusion in main sequence stars?
Which of the following best describes a protostar?
choices: A fully formed star on the main sequence
A collapsing cloud of gas and dust that will become a star
The remnant core of a dead star
questions.answer: A collapsing cloud of gas and dust that will become a star

questions.question: What is the name of the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way?
Which type of star is characterized by its extremely high density and small size?
What is the primary factor determining a star's lifetime?
Which region of the Milky Way contains the oldest stars?
What is the fate of a low to medium-mass star like our Sun?
choices: It will become a black hole
It will explode as a supernova
It will become a white dwarf
It will become a neutron star
questions.answer: It will become a white dwarf

questions.question: What is the main source of energy in stars?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the Milky Way galaxy?
What is the approximate diameter of the Milky Way's disk?
Which of the following best describes a red giant star?
choices: A small, dense star at the end of its life
A massive star that has depleted its core hydrogen
A star in the process of forming
A star that has just entered the main sequence
questions.answer: A massive star that has depleted its core hydrogen

questions.question: What is the primary composition of interstellar gas clouds where stars form?
Which of the following is true about globular clusters?
choices: They are regions of active star formation
They are found primarily in the galactic disk
They contain mostly young, metal-rich stars
They are dense groups of old stars in the galactic halo
questions.answer: They are dense groups of old stars in the galactic halo

questions.question: What is the main difference between a neutron star and a black hole?
choices: Black holes have a solid surface
Neutron stars have a detectable surface, while black holes do not
Black holes are less massive than neutron stars
questions.answer: Neutron stars have a detectable surface, while black holes do not

questions.question: Which phase of stellar evolution is characterized by the fusion of helium into carbon?
What is the primary driver of a star's evolution off the main sequence?
Which of the following best describes the structure of the Milky Way?
What is the approximate mass of the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way?
Which of the following is NOT a stage in the life cycle of a sun-like star?
What is the primary composition of a white dwarf?
Which region of the Milky Way has the highest rate of star formation?
What is the main factor that determines whether a star will end its life as a white dwarf or a neutron star?
Which of the following best describes the concept of hydrostatic equilibrium in stars?
choices: The balance between gravity and rotation
The balance between gravity and outward pressure
The balance between fusion and fission
The balance between magnetic fields and radiation
questions.answer: The balance between gravity and outward pressure

questions.question: What is the approximate thickness of the Milky Way's disk?
Which of the following is true about Population II stars?
choices: They are found primarily in the galactic disk
They are the most massive stars in the galaxy

questions.question: What is the primary role of dark matter in galactic structure?
choices: It provides the material for star formation
It generates the galaxy's magnetic field
It contributes to the galaxy's gravitational field
It powers the supermassive black hole at the galactic center
questions.answer: It contributes to the galaxy's gravitational field

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a planetary nebula?
choices: The expanding outer layers of a dying low-mass star
A cloud of gas surrounding a newly formed star
questions.answer: The expanding outer layers of a dying low-mass star

questions.question: What is the approximate position of our Sun within the Milky Way?
choices: About halfway between the center and edge of the disk
At the very edge of the galactic disk
questions.answer: About halfway between the center and edge of the disk

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a product of stellar nucleosynthesis?
What is the primary difference between Population I and Population II stars?
